content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at position (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the production‑line components for copper-cable processing:
• Burner Inserter at (1.5, 17.5) – fuelled with coal, currently waiting for source items.
• Burner Inserter at (3.5, 17.5) – placed using RIGHT direction; it shows “out of fuel” and is waiting for source items.
• Burner Inserter at (2.5, 16.5) – oriented UP with similar out‑of‑fuel warnings.
• Wooden Chest at (2.5, 17.5) – serving as the factory’s input/output node.
• Assembling Machine at (1.5, 19.5) – tasked with copper-cable production (not receiving power and lacking required copper‑plate).
• Lab with electrical_id 7106 – integrated into the production network (position not specified).
• An adjacent transport belt at (0.5, 17.5) connects components within the factory.

### Extraction and Depot System at position (3.5, 15.5)
Designed to receive items from the extraction process and depot them:
• Depot Wooden Chest at (3.5, 15.5) – placed to serve as an isolated belt depot.
• Depot Burner Inserter at (3.5, 14.5) – oriented UP; its pickup is (3.5, 15.5) and drop is at (3.5, 13.5).
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (4.5, 15.5) – laid adjacent to the depot chest.
• Extraction System Burner Inserter at (–3.5, 27.5) – with drop position (–3.5, 28.5); meant to feed the belt system.
• An auxiliary Wooden Chest at (–3.5, 26.5) – noted as a neighbour to the extraction inserter.

### Smelting Unit at position (–3.0, 19.0)
A paired furnace setup for converting raw ores:
• Stone Furnace at (–3.0, 19.0) – smelting operation producing iron‑plates (currently “no ingredients to smelt”).
• Stone Furnace at (–4.0, 21.0) – converting ores into copper‑plates (also “no ingredients to smelt”).
• Wooden Chest at (–5.5, 21.5) – acting as an output container for smelted products.

### Electricity Generator at position (–0.5, 24.5)
An interconnected power‐generation network:
• Steam Engine at (–0.5, 24.5) – flagged as not connected (lacks input liquid and power network links).
• Boiler at (–5.5, 24.0) – currently out of fuel.
• Burner Inserter at (–3.5, 23.5) – awaiting source items.
• Offshore Pump at (–7.5, 25.5) – supplying water to the system.
• Pipe Groups:
  – PipeGroup (fluid_system=6134) at (–10.5, 16.5)
  – PipeGroup (fluid_system=6135) at (–12.5, 18.5)
  – PipeGroup (fluid_system=6137, water) at (–8.5, 20.5)
  – PipeGroup (fluid_system=6139) at (–2.5, 21.5)
• Electricity Group containing poles at (–2.5, 13.5), (–0.5, 11.5), (0.5, 14.5), (1.5, 22.5), (–2.5, 24.5) and (1.5, 24.5).
• A BeltGroup linking an input at (–0.5, 20.5) to an output at (–1.5, 20.5).

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Incorrect target for transport belt connections  
 – When attempting to connect belts, verify that the target is a proper inserter rather than a steam engine. Adjust the connection to use an inserter that can receive items.

• Placement out of range for wooden chest  
 – Ensure the player is within the allowed placement distance (max ≈10 units) of the target position before attempting to place the chest.

• Undefined variable error ("target_chest" not defined)  
 – Confirm that all variables are correctly defined and referenced to avoid NameErrors. Validate the spelling and existence of variables before use.

• Insufficient inventory for placement  
 – Check the inventory for the required entity (e.g. wooden chest) prior to placement. Craft or retrieve items as needed before attempting placement again.
